brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective of this study is to document that the thrombectomy catheter (Rev-01) is
      effective and safe when used for revascularization in subjects with acute ischemic stroke
      within 8 hours of symptom onset who are ineligible for treatment with IV t-PA, or in whom
      treatment with IV t-PA has been ineffective.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reperfuse Ischemic Vessels With Endovascular Recanalization Device in JAPAN (RIVER JAPAN)

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Onset of symptom is <= 8 hours prior to treatment with Rev-01

          -  Treatment with IV t-PA is ineligible or ineffective

          -  Occluded (presenting TICI score of 0 or 1) M1 or M2 of MCA, basilar or vertebral
             artery, or intracranial segment of ICA, confirmed by angiography that it is
             accessible to the Rev-01

          -  NIHSS score is 8-30

          -  Prior to new focal disabling neurologic deficit, mRS score was 0-2

        Key Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute intracranial hemorrhage

          -  Mass effect or intracranial tumor

          -  Extended early ischemic changes evidenced by CT or MRI

          -  Administration of heparin within 48 hours preceding the onset of stroke and have an
             elevated APTT or PTT above twice of the normal range for the laboratory at
             presentation

          -  Known bleeding diathesis of current use of oral anticoagulants (e.g., warfarin
             sodium) with International Normalized Ration (INR) > 3

          -  Platelet count < 30,000/mm3

          -  Glucose < 50 mg/dL

          -  Severe sustained hypertension (SBP > 185mmHG or DBP > 110mmHG) refractory to
             pharmacological management

          -  Life expectancy of less than 90 days

          -  Pregnancy or females who are lactating

          -  Current participation in an investigational drug or device study

intervention.description: Treatment arm patients have used Rev-01 at least once

facility.name: Kobe City Medical Center General Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Reperfuse Ischemic Vessels With Endovascular Recanalization Device in JAPAN (RIVER JAPAN)

overall_official.affiliation: Kobe City Medical Center General Hospital

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who have recanalization
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately post device procedural angiograms, after the device is removed and before final closure

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Following neurological outcomes    - mRS score    - NIHSS score    - BI score
Proportion of patients with  ICH (symptomatic and asymptomatic)

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
